thread.title: Seattle Seahawks vs. Detroit Lions inactives
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks vs. Detroit Lions inactives - seattlepi.com

author: STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: Seattle Seahawks vs. Detroit Lions inactives
text:
As expected, the Seattle Seahawks will be without Marshawn Lynch for the first time since 2011 as the 29-year-old running back sits out Monday night's Week 4 matchup with the Detroit Lions.
Lynch was ruled out by the team Sunday with a hamstring injury, as was defensive tackle Brandon Mebane, who suffered a groin injury last week against the Chicago Bears.
In place of "Beast Mode," the team will rely on rookie Thomas Rawls and use veteran Fred Jackson as the third-down back.
The last time Lynch missed a game was in 2011, when he sat out the Hawks' 6-3 loss to the Cleveland Browns on Oct. 23. Lynch was technically active for that game, but did not play after suffering back spasms in pregame warm-ups.
Linebacker Bruce Irvin, who had been listed as questionable after being added to the injury report with an ankle injury after Sunday's walkthrough practice, is active.
Mebane missed seven regular season games in 2014 with a hamstring injury that landed him on injured reserve. He'll be replaced in the starting lineup by third-year player Jordan Hill.
Also inactive for the Seahawks are free safety Steven Terrell (hip flexor), cornerback Tharold Simon (toe), linebacker Kevin Pierre-Louis (hamstring), offensive lineman Kristjan Sokoli and defensive end Demarcus Dobbs (shoulder).
Linebacker DeAndre Levy -- a second-team AP All-Pro in 2014 -- will not make his 2015 debut for the Lions as he continues to deal with a hip injury.
Also out for Detroit are starting running back Joique Bell, starting right guard Larry Warford, defensive end Phillip Hunt, tackle Corey Robinson, tight end Brandon Pettigrew and defensive tackle Jermelle Cudjo.
